label: 小袖
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Small-sleeved kimono,often made of silk, worn by both men and women. During the Edo period the vertical length of the sleeves increased; their horizontal length, however, remained more or less the same, never covering the wrists.［着物、江戸］
